name: Fractured Cities Quiz | Geography Fractures | 15 Questions

questions.explanation:
Los Angeles.

	I was born in Canada but grew up in L.A. It's not as bad as you might think!

Minneapolis.

	One of the twin cities of Minnesota (St. Paul is the other).

Chicago.

	The windy city. You Chicagoans have some pretty heavy-duty winters, don't you?

Florence.

	Wow, what a lovely Italian city! Gorgeous art there. Firenze, right?

Cincinnati.

	Home of the Bengals and the Reds: Cincinnati, Ohio.

Albuquerque.

	If you've never been to New Mexico, the Land of Enchantment, you should go--it's so beautiful there! Some of the bluest skies you'll ever see.

New York.

	You New Yorkers have shown us how brave Americans can be. I'm so sorry you've had to shoulder so much of the burden for the rest of us.

San Francisco.

	I live across the Bay from this beautiful city.

Philadelphia.

	The city of brotherly love, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

Missoula.

	Home of the University of Montana.

Chattanooga.

	A player suggests that visitors to Chattanooga check out the Tennessee aquarium and the real Chattanooga choo choo train track.

New Orleans.

	Great music, great cuisine!

Baltimore.

	Home of Anne Tyler, my favorite living fiction writer. Read her new one: Back When We Were Grown-ups.

Berkeley.

	Berkeley, California, my hometown (actually I live just north of it). Come and visit. The Bay Area has some of the best restaurants in the world! Just in my neighborhood alone, there's Chez Panisse, Lalime's, Rivoli, Britt Marie's, Picante, Cafe Fanny, and I could go on and on.
